data.title: Lee's Farm Wayland – A local community gathering space in the heart of Metro West, Massachusetts
data.text:
A local community gathering space in the heart of Metro West, Massachusetts.

Centrally located on a beautiful stretch of Boston Post Road, Lee’s Farm Wayland is a destination steeped in history.

Originating in the early 19th Century and subsequently run as a working farm for over 50 years, the campus was later adopted into the Northbridge Companies family of properties by local mission-driven philanthropists, Jim Coughlin and Wendy Nowokunski.

Lee’s Farm Wayland aspires to offer unique gathering spaces to connect, relax, get inspired and have fun while supporting the greater community we serve.

Teaching high school and college students the power of entrepreneurship through community collaboration and flower farming.

A portion of revenue from Lee’s Farm Wayland goes toward supporting The Compassionate Caregivers Fund, a 501(c)3 recently established to support front-line healthcare workers by providing funding for episodic crises.
